alert.note: Alert for Harris; Jones; Lamar; Meriwether; Monroe; Pike; Talbot; Troup; Upson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 15 at 4:10AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Georgia and west central Georgia, including the following counties, in central Georgia, Bibb, Bleckley, Crawford, Crisp, Dodge, Dooly, Houston, Jones, Monroe, Peach, Pulaski, Telfair, Twiggs and Wilcox. In west central Georgia, Chattahoochee, Harris, Lamar, Macon, Marion, Meriwether, Muscogee, Pike, Schley, Stewart, Sumter, Talbot, Taylor, Troup, Upson and Webster. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Up to 2-4 inches of rain has fallen across the watch area within the last 24 hours, with localized areas up to 5 inches. Additional rounds of showers and thunderstorms are expected through Thursday, with an additional 1 to 3 inches of rainfall expected. This will result in an increased risk for flash flooding and river flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Harris; Jones; Lamar; Meriwether; Monroe; Pike; Talbot; Troup; Upson
